result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawnda Le Marie Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 1 and 4 are read-in and dismissed.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 4, 2015 by 11:00 a.m.
Concurrent to Pierce County Case.
Not eligible for expungement.
Defendant entitled to 1 day credit unter 973.155.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes: $9.00 restitution to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF398.

$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF398.
Court waives DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days is requested by Agent.

-Cooperate with any assessment or program requested by Agent.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-Participate in Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain employment.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Apply to St. Croix County Drug Court within 10 days, if accepted complete successfully.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
-Follow prenatal care.
AODA within 30 days and follow treatment recommendations.

Per Judge Edward F. Vlack March 3, 2015 - Amend Count 3 of JOC to 1 year probation.

Defendant to report to Probation today February 4, 2015 by 11:00 a.m.
Concurrent with Peirce County Case.
Not eligible for expungement.
Defendant entitled to 1 day credit under 973.155.

  If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Shawnda Le Marie Bennett appeared. Case called at 9:48 am. ADA McKinley makes recommendations. No objection from Atty Chapman. Count 3 is amended to Misdeamener.  
 Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2 and Amended Ct 3. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 and amended 3. On motion of the State, Cts 1 and 4 are read in and dismissed. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

3 years w/h
- Court Costs; No DNA surcharge
- $9.00 Restitution
- 120 Days Jail STAYED
- AODA within 30 Days
- Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation if requested by Agent
- Cooperate with any assessment or program requested by Agent
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to possess a firearm
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Restortive Justice
- Maintain Eployment
- Random UA's and PBT's
- Apply to St. Croix County Drug Court in 10 Days, if accepted complete successfully
- Follow rules and regulation of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Follow all prenatal care
Credit for 1 day

Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Bond is to be Co-Signed by Amy Huot

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,   B.H. or David T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
